reviews.snippet:
We had reservation at 5pm (on labour day). Thought that was the earliest available time, turns out it opens at 5pm (for afternoon session)

Took a taxi from asakusa area which cost around 1000yen i think. There is actually another new outlet at akasuka but we didnt foresee that we are done so early, and had like 2-3 hours to go hence we chilled at lavasara cafe first.

So we came kinda full.

But nothing can beat the meat lol
Soooooo gooooood. You can actually get the same taste at kyomo (malaysia) but triple the price and obviously not in japan

We had i think around three servings.
So so gooodd

I wrote the above when i was still in japan, now forgot already what i wanted to write lol bottom line - highly recommended

Toilet is also clean!

Talked to a friend back in malaysia, she said she goes for the steak here which i also highly recommended.

Oh gosh already thinking of the meat!!

reviews.snippet: 有一種不愉快嘅感覺…因為在入門口時…（可能係因為我並沒有訂位）出現看似經理嘅男人，擺出黑口黑面嘅表情，欠缺日本應有嘅禮貌，可能佢並不是日本人；也可能他們主要想招呼外國客人，身為香港人嘅我，感覺有點不愉快。牛肉幾好食，我叫嘅都係比較貴㗎，希望食得比較好。但我覺得可能在其他日本地道嘅店舖可能感覺會比較愉快。服務員招呼幾好。

extracted_snippet.original: 有一種不愉快嘅感覺…因為在入門口時…（可能係因為我並沒有訂位）出現看似經理嘅男人，擺出黑口黑面嘅表情，欠缺日本應有嘅禮貌，可能佢並不是日本人；也可能他們主要想招呼外國客人，身為香港人嘅我，感覺有點不愉快。牛肉幾好食，我叫嘅都係比較貴㗎，希望食得比較好。但我覺得可能在其他日本地道嘅店舖可能感覺會比較愉快。服務員招呼幾好。
extracted_snippet.translated: There was an unpleasant feeling... because when I entered the door... (probably because I didn't have a reservation), a man who looked like a manager appeared. He had a stern expression and lacked the courtesy that Japanese people should have. Maybe he was not Japanese; or maybe they mainly wanted to greet foreign guests. As a Hong Konger, I felt a little uncomfortable. The beef is delicious, but I think it is quite expensive, so I hope it tastes better. But I think it might be more pleasant to go to other authentic Japanese stores. The waiter was very nice.

response.snippet: Thank you very much for your honest feedback. We sincerely apologize for the unpleasant experience you had at the entrance..We value every guest, no matter their background, and it’s disappointing to hear that we fell short in making you feel welcome.We're glad to know that you enjoyed the beef and the service provided by our staff during your meal. Please rest assured that we will address this issue internally to ensure all guests receive the warm, respectful hospitality they deserve. We truly appreciate your feedback and hope we can provide you with a better experience in the future.

reviews.snippet:
Very Disappointing Experience – Not Recommended for Solo Travelers or Couples

I came to this restaurant alone and informed the staff that I was by myself. The staff simply said “okay” without giving me any further information. I sat down and placed my winter jacket, bag, scarf, and large camera on the seat. After waiting for about 5 minutes, a staff member suddenly came back and told me that the seat had been reserved for another customer, and that I would need to wait 20 more minutes. After 20 mins I still not get table. So I comeback with nothing 🤦🏻

What frustrated me the most is that none of the staff apologized—not even once. I felt completely unvalued as a customer. If the table was already reserved, why was I allowed to sit there in the first place? Why didn’t they inform me earlier?

There were still many empty tables around, so it made no sense. It was a complete waste of my time. I had walked 2 kilometers from Akihabara Station just to be treated this way.

I’ve been in Japan for 14 days, and this was by far my worst experience. Sadly, all the staff were Japanese, but their attitude was surprisingly poor—unlike the hospitality I’ve experienced elsewhere in the country.

Definitely not recommended for solo travelers or couples. They simply do not care about you.

response.snippet: We're truly sorry to hear about your disappointing experience and that you felt ignored by a member of our staff — this is not the level of hospitality we aim to provide, and we will address this issue internally to ensure it does not happen again.　Regarding the service charge, we would like to clarify that our restaurant does not charge any service fees. It's possible there may have been a misunderstanding or that the charge occurred at a different establishment.

extracted_snippet.original: We're truly sorry to hear about your disappointing experience and that you felt ignored by a member of our staff — this is not the level of hospitality we aim to provide, and we will address this issue internally to ensure it does not happen again.　Regarding the service charge, we would like to clarify that our restaurant does not charge any service fees. It's possible there may have been a misunderstanding or that the charge occurred at a different establishment.

reviews.snippet:
I had the pleasure of dining at Halal Wagyu Yakiniku Panga, and it absolutely exceeded my expectations on all fronts.

From the moment we arrived, the service was warm, attentive, and efficient, setting a relaxed yet professional tone for the evening. The staff were knowledgeable and happy to guide us through the different cuts of Wagyu on offer, which turned out to be the highlight of the meal.

The quality of the Wagyu beef was truly top-tier—each bite was buttery, tender, and packed with flavor. You could really taste the difference in quality, and the fact that it’s halal makes this place a rare and welcome find for Muslim diners who appreciate premium meat.

The restaurant itself is clean, modern, and thoughtfully designed, offering a comfortable atmosphere that enhances the overall dining experience without being overly flashy.

One thing that stood out was how even the side dishes, like the kimchi, tasted fresh and felt genuinely homemade—a small touch that speaks volumes about the attention to detail here.

Considering the quality of ingredients and overall experience, the price point was very reasonable, especially for Wagyu. It’s a place where you feel like you’re getting excellent value for your money.

Highly recommended for anyone looking to enjoy premium halal yakiniku in a welcoming, high-quality setting.

extracted_snippet.original:
